segment.source: Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services (Windows 10)
segment.target: Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services security policy setting.

segment.source: Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services
segment.target: Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services security policy setting.

segment.source: This policy setting determines which users are prevented from logging on to the device through a Remote Desktop connection through Remote Desktop Services.
segment.target: This policy setting determines which users are prevented from logging on to the device through a Remote Desktop connection through Remote Desktop Services.

segment.source: It is possible for a user to establish a Remote Desktop connection to a particular server, but not be able to log on to the console of that server.
segment.target: It is possible for a user to establish a Remote Desktop connection to a particular server, but not be able to log on to the console of that server.

segment.source: To control who can open a Remote Desktop connection and log on to the device, add the user account to or remove user accounts from the Remote Desktop Users group.
segment.target: To control who can open a Remote Desktop connection and log on to the device, add the user account to or remove user accounts from the Remote Desktop Users group.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values for the most recent supported versions of Windows.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values for the most recent supported versions of Windows.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features, tools, and guidance to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features, tools, and guidance to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: A restart of the computer is not required for this policy setting to be effective.
segment.target: A restart of the computer is not required for this policy setting to be effective.

segment.source: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.
segment.target: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.

segment.source: The Remote System property controls settings for Remote Desktop Services (Allow or prevent remote connections to the computer) and for Remote Assistance (Allow Remote Assistance connections to this computer).
segment.target: The Remote System property controls settings for Remote Desktop Services (Allow or prevent remote connections to the computer) and for Remote Assistance (Allow Remote Assistance connections to this computer).

segment.source: This policy setting supersedes the Allow log on through Remote Desktop Services policy setting if a user account is subject to both policies.
segment.target: This policy setting supersedes the Allow log on through Remote Desktop Services policy setting if a user account is subject to both policies.

segment.source: Group Policy settings are applied in the following order.
segment.target: Group Policy settings are applied in the following order.

segment.source: They overwrite settings on the local device at the next Group Policy update.
segment.target: They overwrite settings on the local device at the next Group Policy update.

segment.source: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.
segment.target: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: Any account with the right to log on through Remote Desktop Services could be used to log on to the remote console of the device.
segment.target: Any account with the right to log on through Remote Desktop Services could be used to log on to the remote console of the device.

segment.source: If this user right is not restricted to legitimate users who need to log on to the console of the computer, malicious users might download and run software that elevates their user rights.
segment.target: If this user right is not restricted to legitimate users who need to log on to the console of the computer, malicious users might download and run software that elevates their user rights.

segment.source: Assign the Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services user right to the built-in local guest account and all service accounts.
segment.target: Assign the Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services user right to the built-in local guest account and all service accounts.

segment.source: If you have installed optional components, such as ASP.NET, you may want to assign this user right to additional accounts that are required by those components.
segment.target: If you have installed optional components, such as ASP.NET, you may want to assign this user right to additional accounts that are required by those components.

segment.source: If you assign the Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services user right to other groups, you could limit the abilities of users who are assigned to specific administrative roles in your environment.
segment.target: If you assign the Deny log on through Remote Desktop Services user right to other groups, you could limit the abilities of users who are assigned to specific administrative roles in your environment.

segment.source: Accounts that have this user right cannot connect to the device through Remote Desktop Services or Remote Assistance.
segment.target: Accounts that have this user right cannot connect to the device through Remote Desktop Services or Remote Assistance.

segment.source: You should confirm that delegated tasks are not negatively affected.
segment.target: You should confirm that delegated tasks are not negatively affected.
